summary: Working towards empowerment of vulnerable populations and communities is at the core of what drives me. Over the years I have been fortunate enough to gain broad experience in managing complex development programmes on a global level. As a result my experience is multi-disciplinary and covers agricultural livelihoods, food systems, agrobiodiversity, poverty reduction, community resilience, migration, diaspora engagement, social policy, human rights, child protection, youth development, gender mainstreaming, sexual reproductive rights, HIV/AIDS and WASH working within the United Nations and international NGOs. In addition, I have conducted research for organisations such as the AU, ODI, GIZ, FHI360 and the UN. Drawing on my academic background in development studies and my vast work experience I continue to contribute towards an equitable world.

profile_positions.description: I currently lead the work on farmer seed enterprises within SD=HS a global programme focused on empowering smallholder farmers and promoting crop diversity in the context of climate change. My component strives to empower indigenous peoples and smallholder farmers to improve their livelihoods, income and seed security through improved seed production capacities and knowledge on how markets work. I provide strategic direction, technical backstopping, capacity building, and direct operational support to national partners and stakeholder in China, Uganda, Zambia, Zimbabwe, Nepal, Guatemala and Peru.

profile_positions.description: The African Diaspora Policy Centre (ADPC) is a Hague based Think Tanked focused on migration and development issues, with particular interest in African diaspora and their role and contribution to development. Particular emphasis was on capacity building on diaspora policy, peacebuilding and advocacy & lobbying.

profile_positions.description: Responsibilities: Coordinated and managed the Government of Botswana/UNDP Poverty Programme. Managed programme activities and budget of US$6 million. Responsible for the inception of the programme, as well as programme implementation, including coordination and management of three component managers and counterparts in government. Facilitated recruitment of and managed consultancy teams for respective outputs. On a technical level have been contributed to policy briefs, developed aide memoires/concept notes, funding proposals, speeches etc. The programme focused on Institutional Capacity Building for Poverty Reduction (i.e. policy, programme, M&E and statistical capacity building), Community Capacity Development, Trade Investment and Small & Medium Enterprise (SME) development.
